definition: the act of looking or seeing or observing, catch sight of
details:
noun
- the act of looking or seeing or observing
= synonyms: survey
- the range of vision
= example: the range of vision
= synonyms: ken
- the ability to see
= synonyms: vision
- an instance of visual perception
= example: an instance of visual perception
- a range of mental vision
= example: a range of mental vision
- anything that is seen
= example: anything that is seen
- (often followed by `of') a large number or amount or extent
= synonyms: plenty, mass, deal, pile, heap, lot, mess, mint, pot, stack, raft, spate, wad, flock, batch, mountain, peck, good deal, great deal, mickle, muckle, passel, quite a little, slew, tidy sum, hatful
verb
- catch sight of
= synonyms: spot
- take aim by looking through the sights of a gun (or other device)
